intro: Siphonoglossa discolor, commonly known as the variable siphonoglossa, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a rough texture. Siphonoglossa discolor is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and stream banks.
